001/*

005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype;
007
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.adapter.MetaschemaDataTypeProvider;
009import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.type.IAtomicOrUnionType;
010import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.CollectionUtil;
011
012import java.util.ArrayList;
013import java.util.LinkedList;
014import java.util.List;
015import java.util.concurrent.locks.Lock;
016import java.util.concurrent.locks.ReadWriteLock;
017import java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantReadWriteLock;
018
019import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
020
021/**
022 * A base implementation of an {@link IDataTypeProvider}, supporting dynamic
023 * loading of Metaschema data type extensions at runtime.
024 * <p>
025 * The {@link MetaschemaDataTypeProvider} class provides an example of how to
026 * use this class to provide new data types.
027 */
028public abstract class AbstractDataTypeProvider implements IDataTypeProvider {
029  @NonNull
030  private final List<IAtomicOrUnionType<?>> abstractTypes = new LinkedList<>();
031  @NonNull
032  private final List<IDataTypeAdapter<?>> library = new LinkedList<>();
033  @NonNull
034  private final ReadWriteLock libraryLock = new ReentrantReadWriteLock();
035
036  @Override
037  public List<? extends IAtomicOrUnionType<?>> getAbstractTypes() {
038    Lock readLock = libraryLock.readLock();
039    readLock.lock();
040    try {
041      return CollectionUtil.unmodifiableList(new ArrayList<>(abstractTypes));
042    } finally {
043      readLock.unlock();
044    }
045  }
046
047  @Override
048  public List<? extends IDataTypeAdapter<?>> getJavaTypeAdapters() {
049    Lock readLock = libraryLock.readLock();
050    readLock.lock();
051    try {
052      // make a defensive copy to protect callers from potential modifications
053      return CollectionUtil.unmodifiableList(new ArrayList<>(library));
054    } finally {
055      readLock.unlock();
056    }
057  }
058
059  /**
060   * Register the provided abstract {@link IAtomicOrUnionType} with the type
061   * system.
062   *
063   * @param type
064   *          the abstract type to register
065   * @throws IllegalArgumentException
066   *           if the type is not abstract
067   */
068  protected void register(@NonNull IAtomicOrUnionType<?> type) {
069    if (type.getAdapter() != null) {
070      throw new IllegalArgumentException(
071          String.format("The type '%s' has an adapter and must be registered using the adapter.",
072              type.toSignature()));
073    }
074    Lock writeLock = libraryLock.writeLock();
075    writeLock.lock();
076    try {
077      abstractTypes.add(type);
078    } finally {
079      writeLock.unlock();
080    }
081  }
082
083  /**
084   * Register the provided {@link IDataTypeAdapter} with the type system.
085   *
086   * @param adapter
087   *          the adapter to register
088   * @throws IllegalArgumentException
089   *           if another type adapter has no name
090   */
091  protected void register(@NonNull IDataTypeAdapter<?> adapter) {
092    if (adapter.getNames().isEmpty()) {
093      throw new IllegalArgumentException("The adapter has no name: " + adapter.getClass().getName());
094    }
095    Lock writeLock = libraryLock.writeLock();
096    writeLock.lock();
097    try {
098      library.add(adapter);
099    } finally {
100      writeLock.unlock();
101    }
102  }
103}
